# New Horizon Aircraft Ltd. (HOVR) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

New Horizon Aircraft Ltd. engages in manufacturing aircraft. It focuses on designing and aiming to build a next generation hybrid electric vertical takeoff and landing aircraft for the regional air mobility market. The company was founded by Eric Brandon Robinson and Brian E. Robinson on March 11, 2022 and is headquartered in Lindsay, Canada. However, other sources indicate the company was founded in 2013, suggesting the 2022 date may refer to a corporate restructuring or public listing.

New Horizon Aircraft Ltd., an aerospace original equipment manufacturer company, designs hybrid-electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft for the regional air mobility market in the United States. It focuses on the design and delivery of the Cavorite X7, a hybrid electric 7-seat aircraft that can take off and land vertically. The company's mission is to develop one of the world's first hybrid eVTOLs that can fly most of its mission exactly like a normal aircraft while offering industry-leading speed, range, and operational utility. As of Jan 8, 2026, the company has 30 employees.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

Currently, New Horizon Aircraft is primarily a development-stage company with no commercial products in operation. The company's sole focus is the development of the Cavorite X7 aircraft platform.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### Cavorite X7 Development
Horizon Aircraft's unique Cavorite X7 aircraft will have a gross weight of an estimated 5,500 lbs with a projected useful load of 1,500 lbs. With an estimated maximum speed of 250 miles per hour and an average range of over 500 miles with fuel reserves, Horizon believes that this experimental aircraft, if eventually licensed for commercial use, would be well-positioned to excel in medical evacuation, critical supply delivery, disaster relief, and special military missions.

### Technical Development Progress
On May 15, 2025, Horizon Aircraft achieved a historic milestone in eVTOL aviation technology. Its Cavorite X7 became the world's first eVTOL aircraft to successfully complete a stable wing-borne flight transition using a novel fan-in-wing design, effectively bridging conventional aircraft capabilities with helicopter-like versatility.

Brian Merker, CFO of Horizon Aircraft added, "With added resources from favorable funding efforts in 2025, we believe we have sufficient capital to ready our full-scale prototype for testing in 18 months."

### All-Weather Capabilities
New Horizon Aircraft, operating as Horizon Aircraft, is accelerating development of the Cavorite X7, one of the world's first hybrid-electric VTOL aircraft designed to fly under Instrument Flight Rules (IFR). This marks a significant competitive advantage, as no existing eVTOL has yet achieved IFR capability, which allows safe flight through cloud, low-visibility conditions and adverse weather. Horizon is also preparing the aircraft for certification to fly in Flight Into Known Icing (FIKI) conditions — a demanding standard currently met only by a limited number of heavy, high-cost helicopters.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Horizon believes that its innovative approach and technology will allow the Cavorite X7 to fly 98% of its mission in a very low-drag configuration like a traditional aircraft. The Company believes that flying most of the time as a normal aircraft is also safer and will make the aircraft easier to certify than other radical new eVTOL designs. The Cavorite X7 will be powered by a hybrid electric system that will recharge the battery array in-flight and post-flight, while also providing significant system redundancy.

Horizon Aircraft intends to successfully complete testing and certification of its Cavorite X7 eVTOL and then scale unit production to meet expected demand from regional operators, emergency service providers, and military customers.

## 8. Market Shares

The eVTOL market is highly fragmented with no dominant players yet established. Key market data:

- The global eVTOL aircraft market size was valued at USD 772 million with a volume of 355 units in 2024 and is estimated to grow at 31.4% CAGR from 2025 to 2034.
- The global eVTOL aircraft market size was estimated at USD 1.35 billion in 2023 and is projected to reach USD 28.6 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 54.9% from 2024 to 2030.

At present, there are 500+ eVTOL companies active worldwide. 2023-2024 proved to be a fruitful period, with EHang and Autoflight receiving type certification and Joby and Archer delivering the first of their aircraft.

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

Major competitors include:
- **Joby Aviation**: As of Q3 2025, it has progressed deep into Stage 4 of the FAA's five-stage certification, completing roughly 70% of required submissions. This gives it a clear lead over domestic rivals for a planned 2026 launch. Joby's credibility is backed by a manufacturing partnership with Toyota for automotive-scale production expertise and a landmark agreement with Delta Air Lines to operate exclusive airport shuttles. With a substantial cash reserve to fund its launch, Joby represents a direct wager on the company most likely to be first to market in the U.S. and set the industry standard.

- **Archer Aviation**: Archer Aviation is Joby's main U.S. competitor, pursuing a pragmatic, capital-efficient path to market by relying on partners for manufacturing and operations. Archer's strength lies in its manufacturing scalability, clear go-to-market plan, and strong regulatory progress. Securing Stellantis's production prowess helps Archer bypass a massive hurdle for any new OEM. Its commercial partnership with United Airlines, which includes a $1 billion conditional order for 100 aircraft, provides a validated initial market and route network.

- **Vertical Aerospace**: The company's future depends on its "best-of-breed" supply chain and a certification pathway focused on Europe (EASA). By using established aerospace partners, Vertical aims to de-risk its technical development and simplify certification, as its core systems come from companies with decades of experience. This approach has attracted a substantial pre-order book from airlines like American Airlines and Virgin Atlantic. However, the company's 2028 certification target lags U.S. rivals, and it requires substantial new funding to reach commercialization.

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Recent Partnerships
Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) announced a partnership with Motion Applied to develop a custom motor drive inverter for the hybrid-electric VTOL Cavorite X7 on December 4, 2025.

Horizon Aircraft today announced that John Wyzykowski has joined the company as a Technical Expert to support the development of its propulsion systems. John is the latest in a series of new hires as Horizon Aircraft continues to bolster its engineering team with people who have proven track records in the aerospace sector. John joins from Lilium, a leading eVTOL developer, where he held the position of Head of Propulsion. With decades of experience in advanced aerospace propulsion, John will play a key role in supporting the ongoing development and optimization of the Cavorite X7, Horizon's revolutionary hybrid-electric eVTOL.

### Board Strengthening
Horizon Aircraft (NASDAQ:HOVR) announced on November 26, 2025 that test pilot-astronaut Jameel Janjua joined its Board of Directors. Janjua brings expertise in experimental test flight, military operations, aerospace engineering and business growth, with more than 5,500 flight hours in over 65 aircraft, service as a Royal Canadian Air Force fighter pilot and instructor at USAF Test Pilot School, and current work as a test pilot for Virgin Galactic. The company said his experience will support Horizon as it builds a full-scale prototype of the Cavorite X7 and prepares for the aircraft certification process.
